titleStmt.title: An act made by the Estates of Parliament conveened by His Maiesties speciall authority, and holden at Edenburgh in Scotland, anno 1641 declaring all Episcopall governement, the civill places and power of kirk-men, the late service booke, booke of cannons and ordination, the High Commission, together with the Articles of Perth for the observation of festivall dayes, kneeling at the communion, &c. to bee utterly unlawfull and still rejected in that kirke and kingdome : whereunto is added an act appointing Parliaments to be held every three yeares.
titleStmt.author: Scotland. Convention of Estates.
Scotland. Parliament.

titleStmt.title: An act made by the Estates of Parliament conveened by His Maiesties speciall authority, and holden at Edenburgh in Scotland, anno 1641 declaring all Episcopall governement, the civill places and power of kirk-men, the late service booke, booke of cannons and ordination, the High Commission, together with the Articles of Perth for the observation of festivall dayes, kneeling at the communion, &c. to bee utterly unlawfull and still rejected in that kirke and kingdome : whereunto is added an act appointing Parliaments to be held every three yeares.
titleStmt.author: Scotland. Convention of Estates.
Scotland. Parliament.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Duke University Library.
